attributes.title: T-shirt
attributes.description:
Created on December 8, 2010 by jenniferksharpe on Sourcemap.org:

Based on the book: The Travels of a T-shirt in the Global Economy, by Pietra Rivoli, Phd.

attributes.name: T-shirt
attributes.title: T-shirt
attributes.description: Based on the book: The Travels of a T-shirt in the Global Economy, by Pietra Rivoli, Phd.

attributes.name: Cotton Fiber
attributes.title: Cotton Fiber
attributes.description: Cotton Fiber from the Reinsch 1,000 acre farm, produces 5000 pounds of cotton lint, enough for about 1.3 million T-shirts.

attributes.name: Cotton Gin
attributes.title: Cotton Gin
attributes.description: Citizen's Shallowater Cooperative Cotton Gin. The Reinsches along with about 300 other farmers, own the Shallowwater gin, and there income from selling cotton is augmented by dividend checks from the cooperatively owned gins.

attributes.name: Spun, Knitted, Cut, Sewn
attributes.title: Spun, Knitted, Cut, Sewn
attributes.description: The Shanghai Number 36 Cotton Yarn Factory. Cotton fiber is Spun into yarn, knitted into cloth, cut into pieces, and sewn into a T-shirt.
